name: quasi-compact and locally of finite type over finite-dimensional is finite-dimensional
description: For every $x \in X$, there is an affine open neighborhood $U = \Spec A$ containing $x$ and $V = \Spec B \subset Y$ with $f(U) \subset V$ such that $A$ is of finite type over $B$. In particular, as $\dim B$ is finite, so is $\dim A$. Since $X$ is quasi-compact, there is a maximum value of $\dim A$.
